facts.text: The first computer bug was an actual bug - a moth trapped in a Harvard Mark II computer in 1947.
The first 1GB hard drive, released in 1980, weighed over 500 pounds and cost $40,000.
The first programming language was Fortran, developed by IBM in 1957.
The first email was sent by Ray Tomlinson to himself in 1971.
Python was named after Monty Python's Flying Circus, not the snake.
The first computer mouse was made of wood and was invented by Doug Engelbart in 1964.
The first website ever created is still online at info.cern.ch.
JavaScript was created in just 10 days by Brendan Eich in 1995.
